review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely perfect, exactly what I needed for all those freezing cold days in South Florida. The extra fabric in the chest really helps fight the cold wind and the jersey is super soft on the inside. I read the reviews and bought a size up, XL. I’m 5’11 189lbs. XL fits great.
review.name: Perfect for South Florida

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great feeling fabric and high quality Jersey. It was also much too short in the torso.  The fit great otherwise.
review.name: Runs short in the torso

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am tall and lean. A size L fits me perfectly. No flapping or bunching. I am not sure about other folks having to size up.
review.name: True to size

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear XL Castelli Perfetto jackets and vests.  This had too much in the mid-section.  Ordered this in XL.  I ordered another XL thermal jersey and it fits better.  183/5'11", reordered L fits perfect.
review.name: Great if right size. Runs large

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I found it to be true to size as stated. It is snug but feels great. I am 5'8" and 150 lbs. The medium fits perfectly.
review.name: Mid weight winter jersey

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered an XL based on other jerseys I've worn and comments here that it runs small. It was way too big. Frustrating. I even measured based on their sizing suggestions.
review.name: What's up with sizing?

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very understated colors, exceptionally warm. Runs a little more true to size then most of the Castelli stuff.
review.name: Really Nice Piece

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had to reorder an XL and could not get the Ashley Blue color. The brushed fleece lining is somewhat thinner than the Castelli Puro Long Sleeve jersey I bought last year. That Puro jersey was a Size L. So, it seems that quality control on sizing has gone down.
review.name: Runs Small
comment: How was the length of the torso?

review.itemreviewed: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had ordered a Size L in Ashley Blue. The jersey was extremely small for a Size L, compared to Castelli thermal fleece jersey, Size L, a few years ago and compared to Giordona LS jerseys I have in Size L. Castelli and Competitive Cyclist need to improve quality control and get sizing sorted out! Such a hassle having to send back for refund and then find out that the desired color is out of stock! We shall see if the XL in different color is okay...
review.name: Sizing Is Way Off!

name: Pisa Limited Edition Thermal Jersey - Men's

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Didn't keep because of odd color combos. The orange is nice but has a pink zipper. No black option, only a dark blue that then has shock lime green accents. No "normal" color options available, only weird statement colorways.
review.name: Jacket seems cool but colors are weird

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This jacket has been more go to mid layer of resort and touring. It has been my main layer for biking to work all winter. 

Things I love: Great fit, soft, no insulation under the arms all the way down to the wrist, insulated hood (so great when the wind picks up on the uphill!)

Things I would change: It is realistically too warm. Reduced or almost no insulation on the back panel would be great. When you have a pack on (which is almost always for me) that area just gets too warm. Outer material pills very dramatically, especially where a backpack will sit. It is making the jacket not look at good when outside outdoor activities. 

All in all I would recommend this jacket though. I basically have lived in it for the last 150 days. I expect to get many more seasons out of it despite my minor issues.
review.name: Very close to perfect

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good description on the website.   Mix of materials, lightweight, pockets all favorable.  Fits nicely.
review.name: Nice multi purpose jacket.

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Breathable and air permeable, but warm sums up the MTN Air Evolve hooded jacket.  The jacket nearly checks off everything I wanted: I basically wanted a warm, breathable and lightweight hoody for high exercsion activities like the TNF L2 Futurefleece or a Polartec Alpha Direct with a more durable face fabric (to better resist snagging on branches and abrasion) and DWR, but not as heavy as Patagonia R1 Techface (which isn't very warm and is heavy).  I wear Large in most brands, and bought a Large which fit well with room.  Even though the sizing chart has me on the larger chest end of Large, I can still wear a thermal base layer without being tight or restrictive and without looking like a sausage.   I like the hand warmer pockets go under the insulation so they are actually hand warming pockets.

I wish Primaloft made a 40gsm Active Evolve for those of us who run warm, which could have made this jacket more to my target wish weight of around 7-8oz. I dislike that Backcountry did not specify that the whole length of the under arm to the arm pit to a little down the side is only shell fabric, so despite being an otherwise warm jacket is offset by conductive chilling against the skin running the length of your arm and below the arm pit.  I with there was some sort of lightweight insulation rather than just face fabric, or face fabric was used just under the arm the same length as it goes down the side with insulation on the rest of the arm.  Seriously, you aren't generating excessive heat on your forearms, but you are most certainly losing heat unnecessarily because of the design.  I also wish there was a hood bungee to cinch down the hood.  I'm just going to say it: the toggle zipper pulls are stupid, and quickly were replaced by single pulls.
review.name: warm, breathable, comfy

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great athletic fit. Elastic cuffs and adjustable waist are perfect for sealing out light breeze. Jacket is incredibly breathable, so it doesn't really stop any amount of wind. You definitely need a shell type layer if its windy out, but the soft liner makes it an incredibly comfy lightweight layer. 

I wear it almost daily with a t-shirt when its 40-50 in Boston, and will also put a Northface puffy and Black Diamond shell over it as a perfect system for hiking the White Mountains in the Winter.

Incredibly versatile layer.
review.name: Great mid-layer.

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket a few weeks and worn it nonstop.  It is very lightweight and comfortable.  I blocks the wind just enough while still being breathable.  No insulation on the underarms feels cool to the touch when wearing short sleeves and does not allow excessive heat buildup with a baselayer.  It's been comfortable from the low 40s to mid 60s to this point, and sheds light rain and dries quickly.  The fit is comfortable for casual wear. Durability will be the big question with the very light and fluffy insulation fabric and lightweight pertex face.  No odor even though I've worn it daily for a couple of weeks.  HIghly recommended, I now want to get rid of some of my standard fleeces that are less versatile.
review.name: Versatile and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This thing is really COOL! The lining in this jacket is actually breathable so I can wear it while mountain biking now that the temps are getting chilly. I run pretty hot while peddling so the 2-way zip allows me to open it up from the bottom while climbing and keep my body temp in a comfortable zone. I'm very excited to try this out as a mid layer this ski season as well as on the skin track.
review.name: Definitely worth adding to the closet

review.itemreviewed: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I loved the MTN Air shell all spring and for summer alpine pursuits. The highlights of that jacket have now expanded to an insulating mid layer with all the benefits. The fit is incredible with sleeves covering the full arm length when reaching high for holds. It breathes well with high output and the shell material continues to protect from wind and light rain. The bright green accents the clean black look well. I'm a big fan of this piece and anticipate it being my go-to midlayer for touring season.
review.name: They've Done it Again!

name: MTN Air EVOLVE Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are definitely the best trail shoes I've ever owned. Coming from Solomon I'm fully converted, these shoes fit snugly and have excellent grip and support.
review.name: New Favourites

review.itemreviewed: Bushido III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these. They are great looking shoes and seemed to be very functional with good support and tread. They felt good on my feet but I went on a one mile walk with the dogs on pavement and came out of it with the worst shin splints I've had since being a runner in college! One mile! Sending them back.
review.name: Painful

name: Bushido III Trail Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Miko 15L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Miko 15L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Miko 15L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have 10 different packs of various sizes for different hiking and mountaineering activities.  The one size I was missing was something to bridge the gap between my 9L lumbar pack and my 24L full feature pack.  Most of the light packs I've seen on the market are nothing more than "bags with straps," with little or no suspension system.  The Miko 15 was the exception.  I've used it now on two short (5 miles) hikes.  The pack is a lot roomier than it appears.  I was able to load it with a surprisingly large amount of gear and still have some room to spare.  The frame and suspension system are excellent, resulting in a pack that is very comfortable when loaded up.  I would have preferred a few more external attachment points on the pack for attaching things like my camera tripod.  I was able to improvise something that worked with the loops on the pack.  Overall, this is an excellent light duty pack and I am very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great Light Duty Pack

review.reviewBody: Great little pack. Very comfortable and well made.
review.name: Miko 15 Rocks

review.reviewBody:
This pack fit my needs as an ultralight pack setup. It’s small and the bladder system is well supported and incorporates well into the pack. 

Great for a day hike or well planned out trips.

I can be hard to fit being a runner-of-size but this, when the straps were adjusted, fit me perfectly. The multiple storage areas and pockets are ideally placed, the pull-rings on the zippers are just right in size. The pack is durable and light. I adore it.
review.name: The Perfect Bag

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this pack last week and have just spent a few days using the pack in Moab and Canyonlands N.P.    A few thoughts ...   

1.  The pack is far more comfortable than any other day pack I have used.  The hip support is surprisingly effective.  
2.  The hydro system I got with the pack works very well with this particular pack.  I love the support built in to hold the reservoir.  The gradient drinking feature on the mouth piece is not necessary from my point of view, but no complaints.  
3.  Durable material and good zippers.  I don't know why, but some pack companies just haven't figured this out yet.  Glad this pack is durable!

As for the longitudinal value of this pack, I can't say yet, but after a week of hard use it doesn't have a scratch.  Seems like a solid pack if you need quality (and for my taste, style; I like the red).   I also plan on taking this pack to Europe this summer... I will update if it is poor.
review.name: Better than expected...

name: Miko 15L Daypack

review.reviewBody: Bought my 1st Tevas in 2020 from a retail store, and loved their fit, support, and design. This shoe however, has a much larger contoured shape around the ball of the foot, making it very bulky. While the shoe fit true to size length wise, the excess material made it esthetically displeasing when laced and too much room across the top of the foot. This must be a new design because I ordered both the Ridgeview low, and the Canyonview, noting the same "bulkiness" in both. I did not walk in beyond the initial trying on, so a fair assessment of walking support and comfort cannot be made.
review.name: Questionable design

review.reviewBody: The shoe is well made and sturdy. I wear a size 10 and have found this a pretty good fit. Like all brands, it fits me just a tad too long, but the next size down would be too short. Perhaps it would feel less clunky if the toe box was more angled. All in all it has been pretty comfortable.
review.name: Nice Shoe

review.reviewBody: The insoles are hard, no give. They hurt my feet and back after wearing for 5 hours. I won't be wearing them anymore.
review.name: Good but limited

review.reviewBody: This style runs short. I bought the same size as my other waterproof Tevas, but this one runs short. Probably should have sent them back but am hoping the toe will stretch a bit.
review.name: Great shoe, but...

review.reviewBody: Teva shoes are about the only brand I can wear due to foot arch issues. I purchased the Ridgeview Low and should have bought them 1/2 a size bigger as they are shorter than expected.
review.name: Run smaller than my other Teva purchases

review.reviewBody: Teva shoes are too narrow for my extra wide feed. They need to make the too more boxy shaped.
review.name: too narrow for my extra wide feet.

author.name: looking for extra wide shoes is a pain

review.reviewBody: The holes for lacing should have metal around them instead of just hole through fabric This is a small expense but would create better quality shoe. There is more room at the front of the shoe personal preference would prefer more narrow I've only had the shoe a short while will see how it holds up
review.name: no

review.reviewBody: So please! Comfortable from the beginning! I wear them all day so days!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: These were comfortable right out of the box; no break-in period was needed. I hike as a regular part of my job, so they have been tested and have been great hiking shoes. Highly recommend! I have also gotten quite a few compliments on the look of them as well.
review.name: Super Comfy

review.reviewBody: The shoes fit, but was too narrow in the two box. I need a wide shoe. Other than being too narrow the shoes fit perfect. very comfortable. They need to make shoes for people with wide feet.
review.name: If the shoes were wide enough in the two box.

name: Ridgeview Low Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Son wanted for Christmas- he loves it, so guess it’s good. Its expensive so it better be.
review.name: Son loves it

review.reviewBody: Very good jacket, keeps you just the right temperature and the waterproofing is great. Pockets and other feature are also designed well. However the jacket run very large, especially in the arms.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd 686 Thermagraph jacket (my last one lasted almost a decade). The newer version is somehow even better than the last. This jacket is ridiculously nice. Checks every box.
review.name: Warm. Dry. Comfortable. Dope.

review.reviewBody: I love this coat. I’m on my second because after a year, the zipper broke and 686 doesn’t cover zippers under warranty. The coat is so comfortable though that i’m willing to risk it again.
review.name: Love, but bad zipper

review.reviewBody: For the most part the jacket keeps me dry in snowy conditions.
review.name: 686 Men’s Hydra Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I really like the look and feel of this jacket. It is nice and comfy with a little boost of warmth. The fit is a little on the large side. I am 6'1", 31" waist, and 165 lbs. The arms are nice and long with room for layering, but the belly area is too big and creates to much space for the body to warm.

I really dislike the zipper. When unzipped, or not fully zipped ot the top, there is a huge flap of jacket at the top that looks ugly and gets in the way. The jacket only works with it completely zipped up.
review.name: Comfy with annoying zipper

review.reviewBody:
First, the materials are quality. No issue there. The issue is that the jacket was put together for someone with the proportions of an orangutan. The arms look like they were supposed to go on an XL, but were attached to a medium. It reminds me of the jacket Marty Jr wore in Back to the Future 2. If I pull them up, and cinch the wrists, It looks so silly and puffy, like a 10yr old in dad’s jacket. I chose a medium due to the site recommendations for my height and weight. 

The second thing that is a deal breaker, is that it must be zipped all the way up. If it isn’t, the larger part of the offset zipper makes a flap that stands straight up in your face. They need to install a button on the back of it to hold it to your chest. Again, nice material. Just figure out how to actually size this thing for how people normally wear jackets. There is no need for arms to go 2-3 inches past the tips of your fingers. And hold that mouth piece down.
review.name: Orangutan arms, annoying flap in the face.

review.reviewBody: Year in year out, this is the jacket I always thinks looks the best in the line, and this year I finally got one. The heat panels are toasty without making the jacket too hot. With my long arms I really appreciate the thumb loops in the sleeves (for pow days). I'm 6'2 and the XL fits perfectly. Very happy with this jacket. Now, just make the exact same style in Gore and without the heat panels to give us more choice!
review.name: The best 686 jacket?

review.reviewBody: Instantly got warm just putting it on- I’m a bigger guy but can still wear layers underneath! Super excited
review.name: Really nice!

review.reviewBody: Got as a gift for a those snowy days and best choice ever. keeps me dry all day.
review.name: great jacket

name: Hydra Thermagraph Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: As usual it works great. It was a replacement because I lost the back of the one I had. They don’t sell the back separately from what I was told.
review.name: Works Great

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: I had to loosen the speed sensor arm in order to get it close enough to the spoke magnet. Tried to be careful but it never worked after that. Considering that this product has to adapt to so many different frames, I just don’t understand why this product is so fragile. Loved my old Wahoo cadence/speed sensor which finally died. This new one needs to be redesigned for real work use.
review.name: Didn’t work on my Look 765 frame

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: Never got a chance to try it out because unfortunately it wasn’t capable with my track bike disc wheel. But I’m sure my friend will enjoy it as a Christmas gift. I’m sure it works great but I wouldn’t recommend it for a disc wheel.
review.name: Never got a chance to

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: Keeps me updated on my ride stats accurately. This when combined with the element app makes understanding what happened a breeze.
review.name: Keeps me updated on my

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: The rubber band mounting can pop off too easily. The zip ties provided were better.
review.name: The rubber band mounting can

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: Everything about the device is great. Easy to install and sync to a Wahoo Element Bolt. The only issue I have with it are the max readings for cadence. I’ve never had a max cadence of 200 rpm. Lol It may not be the sensor’s fault so I couldn’t ding it. I’d buy another.
review.name: Works great.

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: Syncs with blue tooth on iPhone and shows up in the Wahoo app. But when I "start workout" neither the speed or cadence show up. Have tried selecting both Exercise Bike and Cycling with the same results. Does not function as I expected.
review.name: Do not work as expected.

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: Easy to pare, correctly locating the sensor takes little time, but it isn't a problem
review.name: Easy to pare, correctly locating

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody: I generally like the wahoo product line and bought this with the Tickr Fit HRM to "upgrade" my 5 year old Garmin sensors. Guess I didn't do my homework as I found the Speed/Cadence unit to be much less appealing than the more simple designed Garmin Sensors. Don't like the setup and little magnet on the spokes thing. Seems a bit of a throw-back approach? The Blue SC my work just fine, but I am still using the simple Garmins on my bike!
review.name: Didn't do my homework

review.itemreviewed: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor
review.reviewBody:
The product does what it is designed for I believe. 
The accuracy for all measurable categories on the Bolt v2 are questionable so I don't count on it the best I can hope for is constancy.
review.name: Speed and cadence

name: BLUE SC Speed And Cadence Sensor

description: Buy the Backcountry Access Stash Pro 40L UL Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stash Pro 40L UL Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Access Stash Pro 40L UL Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stash Pro 40L UL Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Access Stash Pro 40L UL Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Very impressed with BCA and the thoughtful design that went into this pack. At 40L (+5L or more with the roll top) this pack manages to cover 95% of my use cases. I've used this pack for day tours up to an overnight yurt trip. 

Compressions straps help make the pack feel smaller than the 40L capacity for smaller day missions, but allow you to use the full capacity of the bag for longer missions or overnighters. One of my favorite features is the Side Stash pocket on the lower right side of the pack. I use it to store 1L of water on the way up and it is very easy to access without taking the pack off or unbuckling waist/chest straps. During transition I'm able to keep my pack on and stuff skins into this Side Stash pocket for the way down. 

Intention attachment points for ice axes and helmet carry keep the outside of the bag organized. there are additional tether points for keeping anything else you may need on the outside of your pack (ropes, layers, etc). 

Even with large loads, the pack carries very well thanks to a integrated back panel and comfortable harness system. 

BCA struck a good line between weight savings and functionality with this pack. Excited to continue using it through the rest of the season!
review.name: Impressive Touring Pack

name: Stash Pro 40L UL Pack

review.reviewBody: I’ve had these gloves for a couple seasons now and they have been great.  Pros: Warm, comfortable, great dexterity.  Cons: waterproofing is subpar, trigger loop placement isn’t perfect, doesn’t come with a leash.  I’ve been out with them in -10 with -45 windchill and been ok.  Added my own leash just need something more waterproof for rainy days.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.name: A great glove to work in.

review.reviewBody: Great gloves but the pole connecting loop is in an awkward position for me, needs to be more towards the thumb
review.name: Great gloves but…

review.reviewBody: Super warm and functional it’s been a deep cold winter in Aspen and these babies have kept me warm all season
review.name: Warm and functional

review.reviewBody: Great waterproofing and good DWR. So far no wetting out and good breathability, although I’ve only used it in some light to medium rain/snow. I’d prefer hand warmer pockets to the double chest pockets, but you can get that in the pro version if that’s what you’re looking for.
A must have with this bomber ready for crisp nights after hiking all day in the mountains! 🏔️ gq style and fits loose!
review.name: The perfect crisp fall early winter jack
Well executed

review.reviewBody: Surprisingly, a company like Mammut designs a jacket with a disproportionate arm length. I would understand variation, but at 5-9 with a 41 chest and 33" arm length, the jacket has a 40" length...
review.name: Arms lenght

review.reviewBody: Had enough space to keep my thinner layers with space while ice climbing and fit my helmet nicely. Pockets were spacious and out of the way, didn't use the side vents so I can't comment on them generally, but it was a great outer for a day with snow outside ice climbing
I love this jacket.  The only draw back is the lack of pockets.  The two chest pockets are nice but lower pockets would make this jacket a 10.
review.name: Excellent jacket

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the jacket. Fits well and feels very well constructed. The no hand pockets is a real big miss though I think. Mammut usually does a great job with having harness friendly pockets which I love. Still solid
review.name: Sweet jacket just missing pockets

review.reviewBody: it's light but tough with a great cut that doesn't lift when you raise your arms.
review.name: wonderful alpine jacket

review.reviewBody: Nice coat, water repellant.  Fits helmet well.  Would  recommend ordering a size up if you plan on layering.
review.name: Great coat, runs a bit small

review.reviewBody: Bought this two years ago and love it! Very comfortable, warm, flexible and able to wear for a variety of activities. Breaths well and can be used as a midlayer on the very cold days
review.name: Two chest pockets are nice.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket with fantastic lightness and compressibility. Love the wind proofing. Easy to use in much colder weather due to the wind stopping power. The only night thing is the zipper. It can sometimes end be harder than it should to hook up.
review.name: Great cool weather jacket.

review.reviewBody: Great light to medium weight jacket.  Good for temps between 35-55 degrees f.  It's really close to 5 stars.  The part missing for me is a way to stuff it into it's own pocket.  I have the very light weight Kor Airshell that does.  Was really hoping this one would too.  For backpacking, Mtn Biking and general camping use.
review.name: 4.5 stars!  Great lightweight hoody

review.reviewBody: My new favorite hoody.  This latest product is a go-to!
review.name: Love it so much I bought a secong color

review.reviewBody: I just got back from a 30 day trip to Pakistan that culminated in paddling the Rondu Gorge of the Indus. With 20 days on the water and a whole crew of four using the Astral Indus PFD, I got a really good for how this PFD works in the context it was designed for - class five big water paddling. I personally took three swims in the Indus. Two of the swims were relatively expected with large holes and a crew of safety at the bottom. I was stoked to have the extra flotation and it was noticeable when as soon as I flushed out of the hole I was quick to the surface and able to get to shore with the help of the safety crew. I did however have one swim that was unexpected and scary. In a rushed attempt to set safety for a friend, I seal launched into the water and quickly was pushed into an undercut on shore in my boat, alone and with the rest of my crew up at the top of the rapid I was forced to swim after multiple attempts to get upright in the undercut. I flushed when I swam but was then pushed into a siphon on shore. Here I believe the Indus PFD really helped me to self rescue. As compared to other swims I have encountered in the Astral Greenjacket and other notable pfd's from Kokatat, where even when swimming you are seriously at the mercy of the river. I found that in this specific and dangerous situation, the floatation from the Indus PFD actually held me up on the surface - I caught my breath and was able to get oriented in time to see that I could actually pull and climb out of there without getting pushed from the force of the water under the rocks where my fate would have been different. This is not a glory story, but an honest testament to this PFD used in the river it was designed for - a river with consequences. A big thanks to Astral for designing a PFD that will continue to support the safe progression of the sport.
review.name: Amazing PFD - Indus Tested

review.reviewBody: I would have given the indus a 5 star rating but my only complaint for this new PFD is the access zip to the pocket and the pocket itself. One of the things I loved about the green jacket was that big front pocket with different spots to separate your items in the pocket. I've always carried a simple pin kit in my front pocket i.e prussics, sling and caribinars also ear plugs and a knife. Never been a big fan of the external mounted knives as I've found that they tend to be a snag point and also can easily fall out. I love the extra buoyancy and the overall fit feels very similar to the green jacket. If it was up to me I'd suggest the green jacket 2.0 (same jacket more buoyancy)
review.name: Great PFD but...

review.reviewBody: The extra floatation has been great for teaching river rescue and I haven't noticed the extra bulk when kayaking.  The zipper pocket no lt near as good as the classic clam shell.  It is still new so I am finding hard to keep tight enough.  I think once it is worked on some more the straps and foam will not be as ridged and slippery
review.name: Living the extra floatation

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, but there is no pocket organization.
review.name: Almost perfect. Upgrade from the Green Jacket.

review.reviewBody: Great purchase experience from Backcountry! Astral WAY undersized these vests. If you typically need M/L size up. Reached out to Astral customer service. That was useless…
review.name: Too small!

review.reviewBody: This was my first pullover vest.  Took a little getting used to, but once I had worn it for a couple of days on my most recent multi-day trip I liked it a lot.  Super comfortable and feels very secure.  All of the pockets and fittings are thoughtfully placed.  Flotation was great, tested it out with a swim from camp one afternoon.  Great vest overall.
review.name: First pull over vest

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for long hours in the kayak. Does not ride up in the water!!!  I know some people complained about lack of the clamshell pocket but for me this storage configuration is perfect. Pocket easily takes my iPhone Pro - knife pocket security takes my folder ( as a side bonus you can use your knife clip to hook the skirt out of the way when on land)
review.name: Great PFD

review.reviewBody: I like this new model compare to the astral green jacket that was my last one I love this Indus model make fell with more buoyancy
review.name: Perfect buoyancy

review.reviewBody: Great fit considering the all the extra floatation
review.name: Astral Indus

review.reviewBody: For a person my size 250, it work wonders in whitewaters
review.name: Amazing for my size

name: Indus Personal Flotation Device

review.reviewBody:
Good design.  Very comfortable.   Nice look.  Good lenght.  2-way zipper.  
Has some shortfalls: Needs a heavy duty zipper.  Needs adjustable cuffs. Could use some better waterproofing.  Put some “drop pockets” inside.  Runs a bit large. 
(Purchased on close out sale which overrides the few product shortfalls.)  
(Some shortfalls have been remedied in the newer design.)
review.name: Good…but

review.reviewBody: One would think that a specialty jacket from Mountain Hardware would have solid hardware like heavy duty zippers but these are problematic and take forever to zip up
review.name: Hardware not up to par on Mountain Hardware

review.reviewBody: 90% of the way there. It’s warm, it stretches, the hood is solid, the pockets are well designed. The only two drawbacks are the cuffs and zipper. There are no cuffs so the ends of the sleeves get drafty. I’m going to have a seamstress make some cuffs. I wish they had used more robust zippers that work better.
review.name: 90% good

review.reviewBody: It's great but missing few stuff. Things like thumb loop or extra sleeve at the wrists or water resistance of outer layer. It leaves cold air to get it .
review.name: Great quality and feel , missing design elements affecting it's usability

review.reviewBody: I have had many MWH gear over the years, whole GORE-TEX ski outfit, Monkey jacket and vest, and many more. Unfortunately this jacket is not living to its heritage. Subpar main zipper, no storm flapper to protect it and no adjustable cuffs. Poorly designed despite the baffles and exterior shell which seemed very nice. I had to return it.
review.name: Shadow of a glory past

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof/resistant - wet snow or rain soaks right through immediately. Ordered a size down and it fits although the main body is still very wide. Nice pockets and features and very warm. Just wish it did better in snow...
review.name: Warm and nice but not waterproof at all

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Men’s Stretchdown Parka and absolutely love it. The stretch outer fabric is a game changer….all the warmth, comfort and benefits of a down jacket built into a fabric that actually moves with you. I noticed a big difference compared to my previous down jacket. I also really appreciate the convenience of the 2 chest pockets and love the fleece lined hand pockets, which are super warm when walking around without gloves. I sized down after reading other reviews and would recommend the same. I’m 6foot and 185lb and fit the Medium perfectly.
review.name: Love the stretch!!

review.reviewBody: Great coat.  Good fit.  Good color.  Always liked the brand
review.name: Great winter coat

review.reviewBody: Decent quality product, but my overall dissatisfaction was the fit. Ordered a medium and was not true to size. I’m usually in between a medium and large, but for this should have ordered a small. Chest/stomach area of the jacket was too roomy, even with multiple layers. Felt unflattering and like it would also create a draft when really windy. Overall pretty disappointed.
review.name: Almost great

review.reviewBody: Durable and stretchy..Most down parkas feel delicate compared to this jacket, but not heavy and bulky.
review.name: I'm Down

name: Stretchdown Parka - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great shoes that are great for bouldering
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my Grandson's birthday... he is THRILLED with the fit and performance!!
review.name: Grandma for the WIN

review.reviewBody: Initially bought for comp climbing but quickly turned into my favorite shoe. Super comfortable and just sticks. I love this shoe. Only gripe is the space in the top, but I think that just means I need the LV version.
review.name: Love This Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have trouble getting into Scarpa shoes; but after hearing raves from my Gym Besties, I wanted to try the Dragos.  Trouble is, I wear 45.5 or 46 in La Sportivas and 13 in Evolves; and Dragos only go up to 45.  Ordered a pair in 45 and told myself "If I can get into these shoes, I am going to keep them and hope they stretch."  Well, the first two times wearing it WAS pretty painful; but they DO stretch somewhat so eventually they fit like a glove.Yikes! Dragos are SOFT!! Take Skwanas and divide by 2. I gotta tell you two things: First, I am a really poor, incompetent Boulderer, so I need more structure from my shoes than more experienced Boulderers.  Second, if YOU really like Bouldering, especially on features and toe & heel hooking; you're going to go bananas over the Dragos!  They STICK, STICK, STICK; and the wild downturn and assymmetry really help you. While you CAN catch edges with your big toe, this is not an edging shoe IMO.
review.name: The Gold Standard For Bouldering

review.reviewBody:
Really wish it were possible to write a review without giving stars; I tried these out, and while they felt snug and super tactile, the toe box was slightly too narrow for my feet. My feet aren?t overly wide, but its enough that I have to take into account when sizing shoes like this, and unfortunately these ones in particular were too narrow. This caused some pinching on the sides, and I think because my feet didn?t make it all the way into the toe box properly, my heel wasn?t seated properly either. Because pretty much the entire toe is wrapped in rubber, it?s not likely to stretch laterally. I will say they felt soft, light, and there was a lot of feel in the tip of the toe to negotiate small holds. The asymmetrical design felt a little weird the way it twisted your foot, but I can kinda see how it works with the rand. 

I want to make it clear that this doesn?t make this shoe bad, per se, just something for prospective buyers to take into account. Which is also why I wish I didn?t have to rate it with stars; the shoe just wasn?t meant for me, but I?m sure it?s great for other people. 

For reference, I have both the VS and VSR, and they fit me perfectly, just wanted something a little less bulky for overhanging boulders. I?d really like to try the Chimera, even though it?s more for sport climbing, because I think laces would help alleviate some of that squeeze with zonal tightening.
review.name: Narrow toe box

name: Drago Climbing Shoe
Drago Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these before leaving to travel for 8 months.  These shorts (and a pair of Prana pants) are my favorite bottoms to wear and I have worn them in 12 countries (and counting), so they have had a LOT of wear.  They are great for hiking, sight-seeing, and everyday use.  I was worried about ordering them online without having the chance to try them on.  However, their fit is great.  I was also disappointed that when I ordered them the only color in my size was Earthtone.  However, I am actually happy with the color and think it looks better in person. I have hand washed them, line dried, machine washed, and machine dried.  They dry quickly, have a bit of stretch (which is great for being active), and didn't show the massive amounts of sweat in hot, humid climates.  Honestly, these shorts have paid for themselves.  I have also received many compliments about this pair of shorts.
review.name: Favorite Shorts for Travel!

review.reviewBody: These are great and similar to the Halle II pants, but slightly lighter material which is great for shorts. The fit is spot on and similar to the pants. They don't have a drawstring, but the waist fits perfectly. Love the Camo which are very slight in the design. Can't wait to really test them out
review.name: Love these and the light material

review.reviewBody: These shorts are perfect. With a simple, sleek design and deep pockets, the Halle shorts are  perfect for nearly occasion. PrAna's stretch fabric is ridiculously comfortable and the fit is true to size. I can't wait to wear these hiking, climbing, and pretty much everywhere else. If you're looking for a super comfortable, and versatile pair of shorts, look no further.
review.name: The Only Shorts I Want to Wear

review.reviewBody: These shorts are great for outdoor pursuits like hiking or camping, and are very comfortable. The fabric has a bit of stretch & feels breathable, and the mesh pockets are super deep which is hard to find on women's bottoms. They can also be dressed up with a cute top & sandals for around town, so they're an awesome all-around pair of shorts that are great for almost anything.
review.name: Super Versatile

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for a vacation I am going on at the end of the month. I love the fit and they cover you enough to go on hikes but can still keep you cool, comforable and cute
review.name: Love these shorts!

name: Halle II 5in Short - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's
Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a versatile layer that reminds me a little of the R.5 weight that Patagonia used to have, although it is even lighter than that. I am a huge fan of microgrid fleece. Warmth for weight of this top is stellar. The main issue with it is that it seems like it’s supposed to be a first layer, but it has too many uncomfortable seams for that (I totally don’t get the point of the under bust seams in particular) so I wear it over a very synthetic baselayer. Sizing is slightly bigger than XS usually is in Backcountry, so folks who complain about tight arms, etc. will probably like this top better, but that makes the fit worse for a true XS like me who is just a little too big/adult-shaped to fit into kid’s sizes. The other thing I would change about this top is I’d rather have raglan sleeves. But for the sale price I cannot complain. No data on durability yet but it seems like it would be pretty sturdy under reasonable circumstances.
review.name: Really nice lightweight warmth

review.itemreviewed: Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: This product was way smaller than any other size M I have worn
review.name: way to   small

review.itemreviewed: Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fit is perfect and it keeps you warm.
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore this on a fall hike today and I was BEYOND impressed with its temperature regulation. Going uphill in the sun was hot and down in the shade was very cold, and I was the perfect temp in this the whole time. It also is not smelly after the hike like most synthetic baselayers would be. Can’t wait to try it out skiing this winter
review.name: Most amazing fabric!!

name: Pines Microgrid Ultralight 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent material, dries more quickly than cotton and I still get sweaty but at least it’s less so. Good price too!
review.name: Quick drying

review.reviewBody: Comfy and stylish great for avoiding swamp butt, plus I get to wash them in the sink, so they’re easy to clean
review.name: Cool and Comfy!

review.reviewBody:
The Give-N-Go 1.0 were literally the perfect performance underwear to ever exist. The 2.0 is a perfect example of a product that was changed but not improved. 
The worst change is with the waistband. The elastic looks and feels cheap. The 1.0 waistband was so comfortable and never deformed after years of use. 
The body material is also worse. It’s breathable, but pills awfully. 
If I could buy the 1.0 again, I would replace all of my undies. But I wouldn’t recommend the 2.0 to anyone.
review.name: Bring back the 1.0!!!

review.reviewBody: Exposed elastic is a no-no for so many people, me included, makes me itch and leaves marks. I loved how there was no elastic on the original sport hipkinis, it wasn’t necessary… bought them for years and they were all I wore. A bonus was that they looked more polished, less like underwear without the elastic, and could pass for boyshort swim bottoms in a pinch (like when hiking to a hot spring or swimming hole). I am not happy with the change!! These new ones just suck!!
review.name: Bring back the originals!!

review.reviewBody: I didn’t want to agree with the other one star reviews but I’m one of those who has a bunch of original pairs and when I needed to restock was disappointed by the changes.  I can handle the change in fabric and waistband. My issue is with the elastic around the legs. The stitching on the new pairs seem to have a scratchier thread or the lack of soft binding (like on the old pairs) causes chafing on me.  I wish ExOfficio would have a “you asked so we brought back the originals” moment.
review.name: Why change a good thing

description: Buy the Black Diamond Expedition WR 3 Trek Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Expedition WR 3 Trek Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Expedition WR 3 Trek Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these poles because it allows me to add a camera, whippet, or other items. I bought the adapter and am pleased with the quality.
review.name: Great ski poles

review.reviewBody: These poles are the lightest whippet ready poles you can find plus they have the extended grip on them and they come in a fun color. Can’t wait to get out there this season!
review.name: Just what I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: Lite enough and comfy the resort and uphill backcountry adventure. Like that I can add my whippet to either one when the need arises.
review.name: Lite, bright and just right.

review.reviewBody: Great light weight poles. We have used them for skinning and down hill and they work great. Easy to adjust and really sturdy. Love them!
review.name: LOVE THEM

review.reviewBody: I bought these because they seem well constructed and whippet compatible which I had a whippet attachment laying around. They have proven to be much more durable than my previous pair of folding black diamond poles and the whippet attachment goes on and off no problem. I would give 5 stars but, as someone else pointed out in their review, the poles don’t stay completely collapsed; the bottom 2 - 3 inches will float in and out. This seems due to the taper of the pole near the bottom clasp and is just something you’ll have to deal with when using this pole.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Hard to dream up a more reliable set of poles. The Expedition Three poles have been my go-to for years. They haven't ever broke on me out in the backcountry or on an expedition. These things are burly and light weight. Sure they aren't as light as carbon but the extra protection is well worth the weight. Nothing worse than a broken pole with more laps to be had or a steep peak ahead. I love the adjustments in sizing, short for the way up, long for the skate ski out. Plus an option to add a whippet head, dang!
review.name: Dream Poles

review.reviewBody:
Great poles! Good weight, great grips, nice feature with the whippet attachment option and camera adapter option!
However, when fully collapsing the poles the last 3 inches of the lower part won't be held by the flick lock clamp! The poles are tapering off, and the clamp is too large to securely hold the last bit of the poles. Hence the actual collapsed length of the poles is quite a bit longer than advertised. See my video.
I tightened the screw of the lower clamp, but it won't ever grab the pole.
Otherwise great product.
review.name: Great poles with one big flaw…

review.reviewBody: Light and sturdy poles. I use them with single or double Whippets which are easily and quickly attached. The foam extended grip is nice to minimize the need to adjust the pole length. The black finish of the lower section scratched easily with ski edge contact, as expected. My biggest concern is the rubber material of the upper grip, which is fragile and may flake with any abrasive contact. I appreciate the short collapses length for pack Cary and storage. Overall I really like the poles and they are a good upgrade over my older aluminum BD poles with whippet compatibility.
review.name: Great poles.

review.reviewBody: I used the old expedition 3 ski pole for several years and liked them enough to get the same model when I accidently lost one in a parking lot. Big fan of the new built-in whippet attachment. Very durable and reliable pole.
review.name: Great Poles

review.reviewBody: I haven't gotten to put them through their paces but initial impressions are very good. They are noticeably more robust than the usual poles I get and end up snapping, the whippet attaches securely and they have a comfortable grip. I personally don't find the strap as comfortable as I hoped but functionally it works.
review.name: Feel solid

name: Expedition WR 3 Trek Pole

review.reviewBody: I am a person who walks a TON of dogs both on the asphalt and in the woods every day. I go through a LOT of sneakers/boots/running shoes/trail shoes. I have never owned a pair of SCOTTs before. Out of the box they were a bit tough, uncomfortable and snug on my size ladies 10M feet. My feet have zero issues and I have been a 10M my whole life. One the 1st day they made my feet fall asleep after I laced them up and before I left the house - super rigid and the material does not give at all. After the first day they were a bit better and the feeling came back in my toes after a day of walking (about 6  miles). I would suggest going up a half-size if possible. I ordered another different model of Scott trail runners on clearance in two different colors and they are so snug I literally cannot get my foot inside. the others are way too tight front to back and left to right and nowhere near true to size. I will review those also and I don;t know what to do because they were FINAL SALE. The trad on these sneakers is amazing though. Like having brand new tires on your car. great for the leaves & mud and sticks I battle every day.  I enclosed a few photos.
review.name: Stiff & Snug but durable & GR8 TRACTION!

review.reviewBody:

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Whippet Ski Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Although I haven't used this yet. I've owned 3 different whippets over their evolution. And this one is by far the nicest one. Now has extra grip for the steep steep spots. Can separate axe part for safer travels when not needed. Definitely recommend this whippet.
review.name: New whippet

review.reviewBody: I’ve never used this product to self arrest and seldom feel the need to use it for descents, although I have. What I really love about it, is that it turns a ski pole into “half” a mountaineering axe and is great for ascents that almost require a second axe! I’ve mostly used it in Colorado and the PNW!
review.name: Great for climbing!

review.reviewBody: took a pretty big slide while touring a couple weeks ago and bought this that night. not something you want to rely on while touring but feels great to have it in icey side hill conditions. Well worth it! Kind of heavy relative to my other poles but not too bad to get used to
review.name: awesome tool

review.reviewBody: Amazing. So good. It performs big when it needs to be and very tough/hard!
review.name: Best pole

review.reviewBody: I was slow to adopt the latest-generation whippet after using an old carbon one for the last 12 years. I finally caved and this works exactly like it should. The connection between the pick and pole feels super solid. It's easy to throw the pick in your pack when it's not needed. I actually enjoy Whippet-worthy tours more now that I can just put the pick on when I need it.
review.name: Great evolution of a classic tool

review.reviewBody: The Whippet is a great addition to my backcountry ski gear selection. When you're skiing in "no-fall" terrain, it's nice to know you have a tool, just in case. And when you don't need the ice axe, it's easy to remove and you're left with a really nice ski pole. I would highly recommend the Whippet for any backcountry skier.
review.name: Peace of mind

review.reviewBody: I broke the lower part and there is no replacement part available from Black diamond. I sent them email, they couldn't help me
review.name: No Replacement Parts for available for this pole

review.reviewBody:
Nothing beats a whippet. The extra degree of confidence is inspiring, and the safety factor is great when. skiing hard approaches.
Great addition to any arsenal. Love them.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: Provides extra peace of mind while ski touring in consequential terrain.
review.name: Super Useful

review.reviewBody: The Whippet is perfect for my winter hikes and Colorado 14er climbs that don’t require an axe but could use a bit more than a trekking pole! I wish I would have had this up on Chimborazo as a secondary device to my Ice Axe as well.
review.name: My new go to winter hiking pole

name: Whippet Ski Pole

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Superset 32 Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Superset 32 Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Superset 32 Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Superset 32 Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Superset 32 Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use it for work and working out. Perfect amount space and not bulky
review.name: Great BackPack

review.reviewBody: The superset 30 is best when fully loaded with climbing gear. I’ve used it for both the gym and the crag. It is well-designed and has a great organization system. My one criticism is that is is quite uncomfortable when not fully loaded. The bottom compartment really digs into your lower back. This makes it unusable for day hikes. This problem does not exist when the pack is full with a harness, quick draws,
review.name: Great Climbing Pack

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been using the superset for about a month, and while I wanted to like it, I’m underwhelmed. There’s a lot to like about the pack at face value; it certainly is a different take on design, but as I used it more, I found it more frustrating. It feels like a pack that is different for the sake of being different instead of being useful.

For example, the trim around the bottom panel of the bag is poorly finished. I believe it’s a plastic tube/wire insulated in fabric. The finishing point is in the bottom middle of the pack right where it sits on your back while wearing the pack. If you are wearing a thin shirt, you’re going to feel it, and really thin shirts get snagged on the roughly finished material. I don’t carry the bag using two straps anymore for this reason. The bag is generally not comfortable to carry because of the way the straps are attached to the bag, but the poor finish made it really disappointing. If the finish was off to the side, it would be a non issue.

The other frustrating design choice is the trade off between the full zip back panel and a vertical carry handle. The two tiny vertical carry loops on the side of top opening seem flimsy, and I’m afraid to use them with a full load. I’ve tried the side carry briefcase handle, but it puts the bag at an angle where your water bottle will fall out the bottle pocket on the other side of the bag if you’re not careful. There needs to be a better way to vertical carry the bag.

I may try to add a vertical carry handle somewhere, but I’m not sure what to do about the rough finish on the bottom tubing. I may try to tape over it or sand it down.
review.name: Interesting, but execution is lacking

review.reviewBody:
I love a lot of things about this bag as currently many backpacks don't combine the features it has.... I use it as a gym work bag, and I often carry bigger workout gear, and I just love the cinch top functionality on a gym work bag.... the flexibility in volume and ease of access is really pleasant to use in my opinion.

Love: 
1. Cinch top 
2. OffersLaptop Carry
3. External utility loops on side
4. 30L liter capacity
5. Stands up on it's own

Gripes (mostly in regards to laptop compartment)
1. Laptop compartment is way too snug. It takes me at least one minute to put my 15 inch macbook pro. I really have to wiggle it in. This is a huge miss in my book
2. internal vertical pockets are quite small, and when I do use them, I feel it through the backpack back panel. 
3. Water bottle pocket is not very stable.... this is also something I wish you'd fix with the District 24, my water bottle often falls out. 

Suggestions: 
I'd really appreciate a different setup for carrying electronics.... maybe the same front admin panel as the mission rover could work well, or an external zip like the 2-day Assault....I'd also appreciate one more external detail pocket and a slightly bigger overall volume...maybe 32-35L! 

More thoughts: Lastly, I don't use the bottom pocket because I find it challenging to easily get in and out of it, but nevertheless I really appreciate that the compartment folds out the way when you are not using it.
review.name: Almost

review.reviewBody:
I really love MR bags and own/have owned a bunch of them so when i saw a gymbag / Boulrdering bag i was overhyped :) 
This bag looks really cool, well design, tough as nail.... But need improvements after a couple of weeks of bouldering.

First, not that comfy, especially for short people. And second, it is not as spacious as any crag bag, and that is really the most disapointing part.

The opening on the back is more a gadget feature, and also rip off the possibility of a rigid frame :/

Overall so not that great, i'll wait for a revision to try again
review.name: Not that great

review.reviewBody: Great design the bag just needs to be bigger probably about double the size like other reviewers have said. If you fill in the main duffel area too almost full/full the shoe pocket on the bottom and dirty clothes pocket become almost useless. The duffel storage area is also way too small if you plan too put anything somewhat bulky in there, for me a pair of boxing gloves and shin guards barley fit in the bag, Add a gi and a change of clothes and it’s too much. Anything long like my shin guards will poke into the shoe pouch on the bottom and make it very tiny, i use it as the dirty clothes pouch instead because there’s no way shoes will fit in there. it would be fine if you only need a change of clothes, towel, a snack and maybe a few other things. this is what it looks like with just a pair of shin guards and boxing gloves inside. i wish i could take a video too give a good view of what it’s like with stuff inside.
review.name: Great design, too small of a bag

review.reviewBody: Very well designed and good attention to detail. Everything was well thought out on this bag and is very convenient.
review.name: Well constructed!

review.reviewBody: I got this as an EDC bag, at first I wanted the black but they were sold out so I got the blue and white (one for climbing/gym one for EDC) I really like the front admin pocket and panel and how the whole thing opens up for easy access. I think there are a couple improvements which will happen on the next generation. Most specifically I'd love to see a top that closed with a pocket, similar to other backpacking bags with the cinch closer. I also wish the shoe pocket was a little bigger. I use this for rock climbing and for swimming and can fit either items in there but it'd be great if I could fit larger wet items too. That being said this is my new EDC bag and I love it, using it almost every day. I'm also really glad I got the blue color as it works both on the beach or on a hike.
review.name: Great EDC bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag to use between school and the gym and I’ve loved it. It has enough room to carry my laptop, a harness, 40m rope, chalk bag(s) and my shoes. The front storage is so useful for getting to any small items and the designated shoe pocket keeps your bag from getting gross. Everyone at the gym loves it too!
review.name: Perfect Climbing Gym Bag

review.reviewBody:
I bought this a few weeks ago and I'm so glad I did! The bottom zip is perfect to keep the climbing shoes away from everything else. Easy access to my harness and rope, and some nice organize for my work supplies so I can just go directly from the office to the gym.

I imagine a slightly bigger one would be great for sport or trad gear too.
review.name: Perfect climbing bag

name: Superset 32 Daypack

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Winter Bib Tight GTO C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
We live in a golden age of cycling apparel. Pretty much any product from an established brand will be pretty decent, and when it comes to mainstays like tights, you're spoiled for choice.

Given that, I don't think that you NEED these particular tights, but if you can swing them, they're absolutely wonderful. 

The materials are the best that you'll find, the cut is spot-on, and the chamois is unbeatably comfortable. They also stay in place better than any other pair of tights I've ever worn, and the crotch doesn't ever bunch up. In short, these are tights that you slide on and instantly forget about. 

As far as temperature goes, these are for pretty cold days, but I've been caught out in unexpectedly warm weather, and the textile is nice enough that it manages to breathe remarkably well. Additionally, while they're not water proof rain tights, they keep road spray and melting snow off your skin. Even after 3-4 hours of road spray, these kept me dry. It's clear that these were developed in cooperation with professionals who are forced to spend God only knows how many hours outside in Alpine winters.

So, are these bibs a must? No. Are they measurably better than anything else? Yes. Is it worth it? It depends on who you are. If you're not going to spend a lot of time outside next winter, or if you have a budget to stick to, there are lots of other great tights out there. If you're planning on doing some heavy base miles in crappy weather and you can swing the price, you won't regret dropping the extra coin.
review.name: Exceptionally Comfortable and Well-Made

name: Mille GT Winter Bib Tight GTO C2 - Men's

review.name: Socks are sooo cool

review.reviewBody:
I love Assos clothing.  I wear it on the road and on the trail.  Base layers, bibs jerseys, jackets, vests, warmers, etc.  What I don't wear is Assos socks.  They're terrible.  Bad fit with in the wrong places.  I went on a quest to find the best cycling socks.   Finally, I found Swiftwick.  It was like the heavens smiled on me. I wear the Aspire socks during warm/hot road rides, the Pursuit (wool) socks during cool/cold road rides, and the Flite XT Trail socks on the mountain bike.  I even have a hiking specific pair.  The socks have a nice level of compression without being overly tight.  I love the choice of multiple cuff heights and colors.  There is a reason why so many people took the time to fill out reviews because these socks are too good, you want to tell the world.  

I wear a size 45 Specialized S-Works road shoe and a size L in all Swiftwick socks.
review.name: The best socks, period.

review.reviewBody: I have definitely found the right height of sock. They are the best fitting on the ankle/calf/leg. They seem to hug the leg portion very well and promote good circulation through the foot. The majority of my sock collection are from the GCN Cycling Club monthly sock. While those are good, these are way better. I'm going to continue to be buying these socks!
review.name: Feel So Good

review.reviewBody: If you are looking for new socks, there is no reason not to give these a try if you haven't already. In my experience, they are the most comfortable socks out there. Not only that, but they are pretty durable as well. I have one pair that I've had for a few seasons, and they are still going strong. If you want a sock that offers good compression and breathability, this is the one for you. Also, the 7" length is undoubtedly the best length they offer.
review.name: Best Ever

review.reviewBody:
Right out of the gate Swiftwick has me!

Made in the USA and a Tommy Boy guarantee right front and center "the best socks you will ever wear guaranteed"!  It says it right on the package and it's legit!!!

We all know what it's like out on the ride smashing it out in the heat sweat dripping all over the place, running out of water, your last gel hours ago and no recovery drink in site.  You get home strip the chamois, jersey and the HR strap, but wait a minute.....  These socks are so comfortable you just plop down in the chair, relax and just bask in the awesomeness that is Swiftwick Aspire!

Hands down Swiftwick is my go to sock in the Aspire, Vision or Pursuit in the seven inch length.  

Don't believe me..... get a pair and see if these are not the socks that you grab for that century ride maybe that A group ride you've been struggling to stay in the pack for or that 45m fitness test you got on the trainer that you've been dreading all week since your coach put it on the schedule.    

Maybe that's what they mean in the name Aspire....  now while you ponder that deep thought i'm going for a ride.
review.name: Merica for the win

review.reviewBody: Every time I go to buy a different pair of socks, I end up with the white Aspire 7 in my cart. Pair these puppies with some white shoes and you have a match made in heaven. The logo is not so huge that it's the only thing you see on the socks. Instead, it accents nicely with your shoes, whichever brand they might be. Compression is great and they've lasted me well over the life of any other socks I've used without showing nearly the same signs of wear and tear.
review.name: Confirmed: Best socks ever

review.reviewBody:
This review really is a long time coming. I was introduced to Swiftwick about 10years ago by a friend of mine who started carrying them at his shop. Now, Swiftwick is the only brand of sock that I buy. I started with the Pursuit Fours and that's what got me hooked. Now my drawer is full of Visions and Aspires along with the Pursuits!
The Vision has become my GoTo sock when the furnace kicks on here in Central Texas. My feet never get hot in these socks and they wick sweat like crazy! The cuff never slips and has the perfect amount of compression. My favorite thing about these and every other Swiftwick sock is the way they fit my feet perfectly around my toes. There's NEVER any bunching or extra material on either side of my toes. It's like they were custom made for my feet. I wear a size large and a US size 10. I'd like a few different colors but that's the only area they could improve. Get some!
review.name: The Perfect Sock for hot weather

review.reviewBody: These socks have great compression. I also love the height - not too high or low. They take sweat well and dry really fast. These work well for warm weather riding.
review.name: 5 stars!

review.reviewBody: I really like the compression and fit, and that they don't slide down. Some thought went into the stitching and manufacturing, makes for a solid pair of socks.
review.name: can't beat perfect

name: Aspire Crew Sock

description: Buy the Karakoram Flex Lock Binding Accessory online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Flex Lock Binding Accessory
hasVariant.description: Buy the Karakoram Flex Lock Binding Accessory online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I thought it looked a little gimmicky and a tad pricy,  but I read the only 2 reviews on here last season who praised this so I figured it was worth a shot.  I'm thrilled with this purchase and would definitely purchase again if I break these in the  future. They are going on their 2nd season and don't show any signs of significant wear after roughly 20ish tours on them. If they make it through this season too, (which I think they will) it was money very well spent.

They add a very noticeable amount of response which gives you so much more bite when side hilling. Its like adding a 3rd binding strap from the top of your highback around your boot which you don't realize how much you want that support for uphill until you try something like this. Also an added bonus, it seem to help with my blisters that I normally get on the inside of my feet under the ball of my ankle. Since I don't have to flex out of my boots as hard when trying to stick to the icy skin track, these help keep my feet in the boot like it's supposed to and I don't get as much rubbing in my boot. 

It took me a few minutes and one adjustment during set up to get the orientation of it right and the right tightness. Overall though not hard to figure out or set up properly and Now I can't imagine touring without them. Quick flip of the lever and you have so much more response in the binding, you'll never think about switching to hard boots ever again if you're like me and want to stay in soft boots.  I wouldn't be surprised if this gets other companies to make something for their bindings to match what this simple silly device does.  

I dare you to try it, you wont regret it.
review.name: It's amazing how well this device works

name: Flex Lock Binding Accessory

review.reviewBody:
Great pack. I’ve taken it on a few hikes now and it’s awesome. The straps are wide so it’s very comfortable. It holds everything we need for my family of three to go on a day of hiking, with room to store cold weather gear if needed. 

There is no waist strap, which I thought might be a problem, but the clips across the chest provide plenty of support to offset and balance the weight. 

Pockets on the side hold 32oz Nalgene bottles but larger items will fit. The shoulder straps have pouches on the chest area that are perfect for phones, GPS, smaller bottles (for my kid), all sorts of things. 

I would recommend this to anyone looking for a pack, it’s a great one. 

I will note, I got the pack at 50% off due to a military affiliation site.
review.name: Awesome pack

review.reviewBody: Performed well for EDC in Maui. Carried snorkel and beach stuff to snacks and clothes very bravely.  Flying with it under my seat right now. Good bag and a good companion. We'll done, Gallagator!
review.name: Good travel pack

review.reviewBody: Used this pack on a six day trek of the Kumano Kodō trail in Japan. Super comfortable out the gate and held everything I needed. Well made and super light. Stoked. Thanks!
review.name: Everything you need, nothing you don’t

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these.  Originally the blue which I bought at scheels, and then in the color scheme twig which I purchased online.  I was looking for a quality day pack for hikes.  Mystery ranch did not disappoint.  Having pull tabs to grab on to for zippering and unzippering is awesome.  Love how versatile it is for how to access the bag.  And the top pouch with the key clip is perfect for my wallet and quick access items.  Well thought out design with the shoulder strap pockets and sewn in loops.  I carry a Nalgene bottle of which it has to pockets for.  All in all I very much would recommend this bag.  I had never heard of mystery ranch before this purchase but I will search them out again if another bag is needed.
review.name: Gallagator 25, More than a perfect day pack!

review.reviewBody: I didn’t know how I would feel about this pack when I first got it, but after almost a tear of use I can say I love this backpack. I use it almost daily, from a carry on, for day hikes,  to holding all our pool day supplies. I get more use out of this little pack than any other Mystery Ranch product I own. The only thing keeping me from giving it a 5 star rating is the zippers. I have had few time when I’ve had to fight with them to get the open or closed.
review.name: Great Multi Purpose Pack

review.reviewBody: I have the Coulee 30, and love it, but I need something more packable for a 4 day backpacking trip to Chicago Basin in Colorado. It worked perfectly! It’s upper lightweight with the just right amount of storage and great feel when adjusted properly. The last thing you want summiting the 14ers is a heavy bag hanging off your back. The straps for tying down your helmet are a nice plus a places for your poles are great as well! The zipper system works flawlessly and you “filet” it open in a hurry to get what you need. All in all it is my new go to, lightweight day pack! Super impressed!
review.name: Excellent peak bagging bag

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, solid pack.  Well designed and everything is easily accessible
review.name: Incredible pack

review.reviewBody: Im a day hiker. For various reasons I don’t like multi day overnight hikes. I love hitting trails that get me out and back in a day. So when I was looking for a pack that was versatile enough to use on all day or half day hikes, or an even a day at the beach or park, I chose the Gallagator.  It’s shockingly lightweight, has plenty of exterior pockets on the sides, shoulder straps, and top compartment. The tri zip to the main compartment makes it so easy to access your stuff. There are attachments and daisy chains for hiking poles and other equipment. The shoulder straps are lightweight and comfortable and the sternum straps are easily adjustably. With all the room in the main compartment I probably could have chosen the 20, but during fall & winter hikes I know I’ll appreciate the extra space for cold weather clothing. Overall I love this pack and highly recommend it.
review.name: Day Hikers Dream pack

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack to replace 10 yr old camelback which I use almost daily for cycling and trail running. I opted for the larger pack to make sure I had plenty of room and to make it more versatile for using while traveling. Prob should have stuck w the smaller pack. I’m not a huge fan of the 3 way zipper system. I personally don’t see the advantage of having instant access to things in bottom of your pack in a pack this small, and in a pinch if you need to carry something too large to fit, the three way zippers are not going to hold it closed if something needs to hang out. Not a deal breaker, just my 5 cents worth. Pack materials are lightweight compared to most packs. I’d like it to be a little more rigid, but that’s just a personal preference and time will tell if the materials hold up. This pack will get rained on a lot so we shall see how that goes-I loved the rain fly that was zipped into the bottom of the camelback mule as I used it many times. Biggest complaint I would have about this pack is the storage of a hydration bladder-it’s not separated enough, comes out at an awkward place, and there aren’t any loops that seem to be positioned right for the tube. This is a must for a trail running pack for me so I may need to go another direction if I can figure something better out. I love the pockets on the front straps. I’m getting used to there not being a lower belt strap, it doesn’t flop, I don’t trust the rear outside pockets without a tie at top which I have added. Again-biggest unanswered part of this review is durability and rain proof for me.
review.name: Nice pack. Nice materials.

review.reviewBody: This bag has exceeded all my expectations!  Can pack all essential gear for anything from a day hike to a trip into town with room to spare- all while looking great. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Incredible versatility

name: Gallagator 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Just went snowboarding in these and they were great. Kept me dry and warm all day. There were easy to take on and off and wrist straps kept them right there. The wool gloves were really nice though the seams started to rip after 1 wear.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excited to use these next winter. Very high standards with 686 and you can tell when putting them on. Appreciate the adjusters as well as the strap to put around your arm. The liner with the smart technology is great too, can easily take just the gauntlet off to use my phone. Worth the money in my opinion.
review.name: Great quality, well worth the money.

description: Buy the Giro Ambient Winter Skull Cap online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ambient Winter Skull Cap
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Ambient Winter Skull Cap online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have tried at least five different hats for cycling and the Giro Ambient Winter Skull Cap is the only good one, maybe excellent.  The brim is short, so it does not obscure your vision.  It provides good windblocking.  But most importantly, it covers the ears!  Most hats, including Mavic's and Garneau's extend too far down in the back, so the ear flaps rise up and expose your ears to the colds.  Giro got this one right.  Could use two or three sizes.
review.name: Excellent Hat

review.reviewBody: works real well for those temperatures near freezing and below 5/10°C (~40°C/~50°C). keeps my head and ears warm, and fits well. if you don't have a good pair of shades, the small visor might be an issue on brighter days.
review.name: works as expected

name: Ambient Winter Skull Cap
