review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ordered these for my daughter and they came immediately. Look fabulous and are exactly what I ordered, great fit, great quality.
review.name: Fast, reliable and great product

review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great looking boots to wear in cold, wet and snowy weather
review.name: Perfect waterproof snow boot

review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The toe turns up and the shoe is very stiff. It’s actually fairly uncomfortable to have my foot flexed up like that. They are warm and sturdy, but the shape inside doesn’t seem correctly human.
review.name: Uncomfortable upturned toebox
comment: Hello K F, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry JOAN OF ARCTIC™ Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for shoveling, snowplowing, feeding the horses, walking the dogs or anything outside when the snow is a foot or more.  However the tread is so slippery, I fear I’m gonna fall even when walking down slight incline from the house- .I had to buy extra tracks to snap on the bottom.  They may be cute in the city or milder winter conditions  but if your looking for a more rugged winter boot I’d suggest something else.   Overall comfortable and so far have stood up well for a couple years now.
review.name: Need better traction

review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these as a gift last year, and every time I have tried to wear them I get blisters on my heels and ankles. I wanted to love these, but they just hurt my feet. The sizing is right so that is not the issue, but they just dont work unless you never have to walk at all when wearing them. so sad and disappointing.
review.name: Love the look, hate walking in them.
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm every time I wear them, room for extra socks if you need them.
review.name: Warm

name: Joan Of Arctic Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have three of these and love them. I hope they continue to make them. Lightweight, soft, durable, great sun protection, dry fast.
review.name: My Favorite hiking shirt

review.reviewBody: I have this in two colors. Great fit and lightweight feel that’s perfect for cycling and working in the sun.
review.name: Great fit and quality

review.reviewBody: So comfortable in hot and mild weather, I wear it all the time.  Great comfort from golf to mountain biking and everything in between.
review.name: My favorite outdoor sun shirt

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and light weight.  Just what i was looking for in sun shirt. I'm 5' 6" and the small was perfect
review.name: Just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: I am a fly fishing guide and have tried tons of different sun hoodies for long days on the water and in the sun. These are without a doubt my favorite, extremely comfortable and somehow do great on both warm and cool days!
review.name: Best Sun Hoody

review.reviewBody: Great, fantastic and wonderful also very awesome for me
review.name: Cool

review.reviewBody: Favorite sun shirt.  Of the sunshirts I've tried (Patagonia Cool, Stio Hylas, REI Sahara, and a number of others) it is the coolest.  Still not as cool as a short sleeve shirt, but as good as I've found.  The fit was nice too, not too tight but still fitted enough.  High marks in my book.
review.name: Best I've tried.

review.reviewBody: Thought the material on this would be too thin, but it's actually the perfect weight for outdoor activities. Wore it on an all day climb that went from freezing in the morning to blazing in the afternoon and (with a sweater in the morning) it worked great. Comfortable material too. I'm a girl with broad shoulders and a long torso so I went with the men's and a medium fit me great.
review.name: Solid Sun Shirt

review.reviewBody: Best sun shirt I own. I am pale and fragile and the sun hurts my skin so I own a variety of sun shirts from different brands. This one is easily the best.
review.name: Best Sun shirt I own

name: Crater Lake Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great quality and the fit is perfection. The most flattering parka I’ve found. I looked at reviews on multiple websites and feedback pretty consistently indicated it runs small and to size up. I am 5’4” 145lbs, smaller on the top and a larger behind and I am typically between a S and M in parkas depending on the brand. My measurements were right down the middle of the S range of their size band so I nervously ordered the S and am happy to report the fit is right on.
review.name: I’m in love

review.reviewBody:
Very warm and not bulky
The zipper is problematic and have heard from others who have same parka, having similar issue (difficult to align zipper)
review.name: Warm parka

review.reviewBody: This coat is great - lightweight and styled nicely with a trim waist and A-line hem. The high fill power down seems warm enough.  However, the zipper is really substandard, especially for the price point.  I bought the coat for my mom and she can't make the zipper work at all - it doesn't connect well at the bottom. I have nimbler fingers than she does, but I also had a very hard time making it work.  (On closer look at reviews on this and other websites, I see I'm not the only one with this problem.) Either we will have to replace the zipper or the coat has to go back.  Very disappointing.
review.name: The zipper is a problem

review.reviewBody: Very excited to get what others called light and warm and that ran small. I ordered medium, though I’m a size small and I was swimming. It was really big on me. I usually where a thick sweatshirt under my coats cause I like to feel toasty. But this is so loose I could fit 2 sweatshirts on. So it’s headed back. I’m going to order the small and see what happens. Even though I didn’t wear it out, I liked the quality and lightness.
review.name: Big but haven’t worn it out

review.reviewBody:
I gave this a 5 for weight( very lightweight/!) comfortable top to bottom and excellent warmth! 
I give this a 3 in SIZING- BE AWARE - if you are broad shouldered , hip or larger chest area - SIZE UP! . I ordered the large initially thinking it would run similar two other Kuhl coat products I own- not this one though!
Way too small for me ! 
Once I returned for a larger size it?s PERFECT! Highly recommend!
review.name: Just what I was looking for!

review.reviewBody: This is the third Kuhl  jacket that I have purchased. In the past I have had to size down to a large and have been very comfortable until now. Unfortunately this one has to go back- however I am going to exchange it for the extra large primarily as I have a broader back and a larger chest. Advice :  If you are built like me size up! Otherwise love the style and weight-!!
review.name: Loved everything but the sizing

review.reviewBody:
Jackets never keep me warm enough but this one does. I?m also tall and curvy and this jacket covers me up, sleeves are long and the fit is very attractive. I feel so stylish AND warm when so sport this. I also wore this jacket walking home in a downpour and stayed totally dry. 

The only cons- I sized down because I thought I might need to but after wearing it a while it?s a little snug but I pull it off. It?s still a great jacket. 

The zipper is wierd and sometimes won?t hook up right to zip up. Super bizarre considering how expensive the jacket is.
review.name: Beautiful and Warm
comment: Thank you for the detailed review, Hailey! Happy to hear that you like the jacket overall.

review.reviewBody: So far the best one I tried on. I am 5?9? and 150lb and a M size was perfect. Usually I have a hard time finding jackets with longer sleeves, but this one has everything I was looking for. Very comfortable and super light and the warmest. Shoulders have enough space to not feel constricted, has long sleeves, nice pattern that gives a slim look with noticeable wait and is not to wide at the bottom, but comes around the legs to keep warm.
review.name: The best parka

name: Spyfire Hooded Down Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. No break in. Great for walking sidewalks. Reasonable sale price. Would not hesitate to purchase another pair.
review.name: Comfortable. No break in. Great

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for Hawaii. Wore them through salt water, fresh water, over pumic and concrete streets/sidewalks - never missed a beat!!
I had to rinse-n-wear and sometimes just kept going as is (depending on our activity for the day); they never failed me once. 
Through relatively short hikes, long walks, swimming…this shoe never caused hot-spots or blisters. 
Sizing: I normally wear an 11.5 - 12 so I chose an 11.5 in this shoe. Perfect! Keep in mind, I’m an easy fit for shoes since I have a pretty generic foot size and shape. 
Extra tip, I normally spray my feet with antiperspirant but these shoes stayed wet for nearly two weeks so odor was never as issue. 

I’d buy again and definitely recommend. 
Last note, there was an issue with delivery due to UPS, not Keen. However, when I emailed Keen, they responded within minutes. 
The issue resolved itself. I was just glad to see Keen so “Keen” to respond quickly.
review.name: Buy these!!

review.reviewBody:
Dear KEEN,

You've done it again! 

At first during the unboxing I wasn't that excited when I saw the mid sole (I just spent the last 4+ years in the KEEN SOLR/green with full gum sole/much wider toe box/amazing shoe) wrap up on the toe box. 

Looks amazing! Performance blows looks out of the water! I had these on from Upstate South Carolina all the way to Saco Montana via RV this year. 

I got to test these out in all situations and they are great for whatever task is at hand. The foam mid sole and gum sole work as a team keeping your foot planted. On and off is simple. I even slide these on like a crush down heel. 

No matter the terrain this is a solid platform for your feet, extremely comfortable and they look pretty sweet.
review.name: GET SOME AND GET OUT THERE

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable especially with a medium weight sock.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love my new Hyperport H2 sandals. Very comfortable and a great all around sandal.
review.name: Love my Keen water shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used these shoes.for a white water kayaking trip with a very small amount of hiking. They were perfect!
review.name: Perfect Shoe for My Adventure

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the most comfortable sandals I have ever worn. Very breathable and light, yet extremely durable. I like the “bumper toe” with its foot protection. They also have a great easy-on easy-off design.
review.name: Love. Love. Love ❤️

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable, lightweight, good grip, slip on easy. One problem, for rafting I notice these the rear band can slip off in the water, I almost lost a shoe many times. 

So close to perfect.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
Super comfortable and squishy in a stable way. These work great for even a supinator with wide feet. I normally fit into a Keen 11.5 wide, sometimes a 12 wide. This regular width 11.5 fits well for me.
Not sure how well they’ll “water” as to the wide sole ( might roll your ankle ).
review.name: Super comfortable “ knock around “ sandals.

review.reviewBody: Love them completely! But my legs do not. Going to need to trade them in for a different insole show-insert crying emoji
review.name: Love the color~

description: Buy the Old Town Sportsman Big Water Pedal Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sportsman Big Water Pedal Kayak
hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Sportsman Big Water Pedal Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this kayak about 8 months ago and really waited to provide accurate feedback.  This is a great solid kayak, very fast and stable.  I have been out in saltwater with high winds, swells and can still stand on this no problem.  I have had many great adventures and caught countless fish and made many new kayak friends.  Highly recommend this kayak to anybody interested.  Easy to add on extras as well.
review.name: Awesome kayak very stable and fast

review.reviewBody: I have a 2018 and a 2019 Predator PDL in Urban Camo (white, light gray, black), I love them and protect them because they are awesome. 2019 was the last year Old Town made the version i have with the aluminum rudder and locking front hatch cover. I have not tried one of the newer ones with the plastic rudder. But on paper I think the Bigwater PDL starting in 2020 is a downgrade in quality and a big increase in price. I have read reviews where people think the newer Bigwater PDL is not stable. I find this surprising because the boat looks the same as what I have.  But i do wish Old Town would bring back the old design with aluminum rudder and especially bring back the Urban Camo color. The darker colors available now absorb too much heat in the Florida sun.
review.name: The previous model Predator PDL was better

review.reviewBody: This kayak is extremely stable! Very fast and cuts through the water flawlessly. If you are rolling this kayak then it is your fault for not keeping center of gravity. This kayak is perfect for choppy water and going btb. I personally love it for shallow water sight fishing. I’ve compared this kayak to many out there and still have not found one better. If you spend enough time in it, to really learn it, you will love it.
review.name: Perfectly stable kayak!

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these thinking it was a stable kayak,  but it is not.  This kayak will flip on a dime.  I went back to my old kayak because this one is dangerous in the water.  You better off with a canoe.  I thought Old Town would be a good buy because it has been around for yours,  they make other good products.  I'm an older man and this is not a good stable kayak.  Now I can not get rid of it.
review.name: Sorry, I have to disagree with these

review.reviewBody: Purchased this last year. Very stable and easy to fish from. Navarre kayak makes mods to fix the issues this kayak has such a replacement rudder that is made of metal instead of plastic. Overall a great kayak. Just make sure you visit Navarre kayak Nick is a great guy and will help you set up this kayak right.
review.name: Very stable with a few needed changes

review.reviewBody: ok, a lot of reviews get written when the person has only just gotten the item. many want to know if someone likes the item years afterwards.  so in a nut shell, ohhh heck ya!   my wife and i own 2 of the preditor pdl's (now days big water)   i have put like a million miles on them over the years and even to this day would not trade them for newer kayaks from other companies. (that right there says something)   i have fished for halibut, kings, silvers, pinks, cod, trout to give you a idea.  to say i love this kayak is just way understating it. i am a hard core fisherman in both salt and fresh water.  if i only had one wish it would be that they made these when i was much younger!  (on the up side, i did buy mine the very first year they came out!)  these are truely incredible boats.  i can fish all day with ease (i have a bad back so that was a big worry for me when i got mine)  but i find i can fish  longer in my kayak then i can in a normal boat or just shore fishing.  even after YEARS AND YEARS of fishing in both the salt and fresh water the pedal drives are still going strong. (thats amazing!)   i looked at many other kayaks such as hobbies, wilderness and pescidors just to name a few.  bottom line, KILLER BOAT   if you are on the fence, you are just waisting time and will kick yourself  for having waited.  to the guys at old town, THANK YOU SO MUCH!  for building these wonderful boats!
review.name: tested for over 7 years.

review.reviewBody: Had a blast with the quality, ease of use and modability
review.name: Great kayak

review.reviewBody: I've had it for a year now. I bought it to go beyond the breakers for fishing 6 miles out. I like it more than my tarpon 120x but it isn't better than my brother's top water 120 pdl. His is more stable and the speed is roughly the same. My bigwater pdl feels tippy to the left side and it is hard to jump out so I can drift it back in the surf.
review.name: Good kayak but doesn't less performance.

review.reviewBody: The big water is an all in one fishing experience. I was able to get in and start fishing right away. Moves smoothly through the water and with little effort I can maintain a1.5 mph via the peddles. Generous mounting platforms and plenty of storage.
review.name: Great kayak

review.reviewBody:
I had been considering purchasing a fishing kayak for about five years. So many choices out there! I've had my PDL 132 for about a month, logged a fair amount of time in it and caught a lot of fish to include a few pretty big ones. Fishing and fighting fish from the seat is very comfortable and fun.  

Organizing all the gear I need is easy. My cast net fits behind my seat. I removed the carrying handle from a mid sized cooler and replaced it with a triple rod holder using SS screws and 5200. This fits in the generous bed behind the seat and is secured by the bungee cord system that comes with the kayak. One loop over the handle facing forward and the other over the rod holder, securing the cooler to the kayak but allowing me to easily open the lid of the cooler to put fish in. I put two rods and a landing net in those rod holders and a third rod goes in one of the other two aft facing integrated rod holders. I found the rails located forward of the seat to be unhelpful so I removed them and laced a bungee cord back and forth between the screws using SS fender washers to pin the cord down. Now, a tackle box the size of the one that comes with the kayak will easily stow on each side. I fish with one in the port side, two under the seat and use the starboard stowage for pliers, fish grabber and other items I need to get to often. A boat bag easily slips under the seat that holds other misc gear. 

The universal transducer mount is not universal :-), but it was easy to drill the holes in the removable plate needed to mount my Lowrance transducer. Running the wires was incredibly easy and required no hole drilling that resulted in a professional looking install that only took a few minutes. I mounted my chartplotter/FF to the removable plate located to the right of the pedals and stowed the excess data cable neatly in the space underneath. The power cable is routed under the forward hatch cover not requiring any drilling. Note: when selecting your electronics, avoid a unit with a transducer mounting system that will put the transducer below the plane of the hull or risk damaging it when you drag the craft over anything. The battery stowage bag is sized to fit a small 12V battery. I purchased a 10ah battery which fits very neatly in there, but found I needed more run time and upgraded to a larger battery placed in a stowage box which I am still problem solving for a better solution to prevent it from sliding around the forward hatch.

The integrated bow carrying handle is great. I run a tie down strap through it when securing my kayak inside my truck and another strap across the middle, through the side carrying handles to finish the aft secure. This approach is incredibly fast and easy and leaves no doubt that the kayak is not going to slide out of the truck. The aft integrated handles are in the right place and make it easy to get a good purchase on the stern when carrying with another person. 

While on the water, I use the opening of the forward carry to hold a small anchor. I route the line through the carrying handle, under the round bar of the pedal unit and tie it off to the carrying handle on the same side. The anchor line goes in an anchor line bag stowed in the forward hatch. That anchor is used on every trip whether to dig into the beach preventing the kayak from floating away on a rising tide while I'm walking the shore throwing the cast net for bait or holding position near a school of fish. A factory integrated anchor mounting system on the bow would be a huge plus. 

I can really scoot with the pedal system even against a strong current and troll for hours effortlessly, which I must say I did not expect.

The rudder friction knob feels a little "economical" and I think there is a better system to be had. The stainless screw is slowly cutting the groove it rests in and I find that I need to remove the chips it cuts to keep the rudder control moving freely. Perhaps more of a cam type brake would be an improvement?

After looking at so many other fishing kayaks over the past few years, when I saw the PDL 132, I knew why I hadn't purchased a fishing kayak until now. After several trips, the differences are even more clear. I am extremely happy with my new Old Town and glad I waited for the right one to take to the dance.
review.name: Great Fishing Platform

name: Sportsman Big Water Pedal Kayak

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Wheelie 65L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mission Wheelie 65L Rolling Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Wheelie 65L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this travel bag because I needed something quick to replace my Mission Wheelie 130 which was in for repairs from heavy damage by the baggage folks of American Airlines. I travel a lot for the U.S. Forest Service for incident management, and have found this Mission 65 to be a great travel bag for short trips with the same features as the larger 130 version. Very pleased with the weight, mobility and updated materials used on this new version.
review.name: Mission Wheelie 65

review.reviewBody: I appreciate the additional pockets and zippers which allow better organization. Even though I find shoe storage silly as it makes it so much harder to pack around the shoes, it's nice to have as an option. Handle and wheels are sturdy which is great. Everything else is worse: The new fabric is not as sturdy, already seeing significant degradation after three airline trips with never more than one plane switch over. The ID pocket is so poorly placed and designed I doubt your card will survive more than two consecutive flights. But the real issue is the sizing. I don't know who is in charge over there but I'm exhausted by MR making objectively poor decisions while also lazily designing products. I regularly see 65l packs as carry-ons and these guys think that's all of a sudden a good check in size? Filled with clothes, the 65l weighs 35 pounds. Everyone who has ever traveled anywhere knows that the ideal size for a checked bag is 90 liters. The old 80l was ok and I hoped they would increase capacity to 90 but here we are at 65. 110l is almost always too heavy which means the whole series is practically worthless for air travel. I would recommend it for vehicular travel but I imagine that few people are shopping for that purpose.
review.name: It's mostly better

review.reviewBody: Bought this as my bag for week-long cross-state bicycle ride. First use was slung under the shuttle bus to beginning town then bag was collected every morning & transported to next night's hotel.  Held more than enough clothes, bike gear, shoes for the week. On  last day had water bottles, empty panniers, everything I didn't want to carry was stuffed into it and slung under the bus. No damage, no loose ends, no problems at all. Bottom hard shell protects CPAP case well when padded with clothes.
review.name: Robust, easy to handle, protected CPAP etc.

review.reviewBody: Great roller suitcase for all my travel needs.  Many pockets for organization!
review.name: Awesome roller!

review.reviewBody: this is the MR version of a stoable airline travel bag.  I like that the upper half is soft so you can smash it in when on an overloaded flight.  the wheels look bomb proof.  has a handle everywhere.  Will be buying another one size up soon.
review.name: tougher than the rest

review.reviewBody:
I'm a long-time MR customer and advocate. I love their products and pack innovations. They always think of everything when it comes to how they develop products. However, in this instance (45L Mission Wheelie), they have fallen just short. The issue is getting the bag in and out of overhead carry-on spaces on some models of planes, including Delta's smaller domestic jets. 

The online measurements state it is 12", but the bag I received is 12.5" (at the wheels). Yes, this is a duffle style and can be "smooshed." However, if the internal braces are engaged, it is quite rigid and too wide to fit through the opening of the overheads. Let's be frank, you aren't going to wheel this around an airport without the braces engaged because it would stand on its own and it is not feasible to disengage the braces before boarding.

All other aspects exceed my expectations -They are up to MR's standard. But I needed a carry-on for domestic travel, and now I am checking this thing at the gate on each flight -- therefore, rendering it useless for my needs.
review.name: 45L - Says TSA approved, but doesn't fit Delta

review.reviewBody: Love everything about this pack, the size, the breakdown, the wheeling/handling. The thing I miss is locking function. I also got the mission 45 and there is locking function on the zippers which I love and thought was offered on the larger. Overall though very satisfied. Traveling to Nepal in a few weeks for a trip to Everest so check back after I truly get some miles on this product.
review.name: Bomb proof with tons of space!

review.reviewBody: I am sailing in Croatia so i needed a soft side luggage for storage on the boat. This is perfect for carrying all my stuff and stores well when not in use.  The bottom is secure and crush proof.
review.name: This is a beast of suitcase

review.reviewBody: Ight be bomb proof, but is not United Airlines proof. They managed to tear a hole in my 80l., on the first flight. Other than that, I love it.
review.name: Bomb proof?

review.reviewBody: This bag has been an awesome upgrade. Internal compartments are well thought out. There is a dirty clothes area as well as a shoe pocket and other compartments to keep things tidy. Looks great and is easy to pack around. I have been able to fit a weeks worth of work clothes in the bag, plus extra travel gear and had no problems. Materials seem to be solid as well. I look forward to using this bag for years to come.
review.name: Great Bag!

name: Mission Wheelie 65L Rolling Gear Bag
